alert.note: Alert for Johnston (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 04 at 4:50AM EST until January 05 at 12:08PM EST by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in North Carolina... Neuse River At Smithfield affecting Johnston County. Neuse River Near Clayton affecting Johnston County. For the Neuse River...including Clayton, Smithfield, Goldsboro... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Neuse River Near Clayton. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Mindor flooding begins. Minor overflow occurs on both banks. Water reaches the edge of the Neuse River Greenway trail. At 10.0 feet, The Neuse River Greenway at Covered Bridge Road begins to flood. At 13.0 feet, Flooding will close the Neuse River Greenway trail. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:15 AM EST Tuesday the stage was 11.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:15 AM EST Tuesday was 11.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 11.8 feet this morning. It will then fall below flood stage just early Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.6 feet on 09/16/2018. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 am EST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Thu Fri Sat Neuse River Clayton 9.0 11.8 Tue 4 am EST 12.2 7.2 3.6 2.4 1.9 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/rah/rivers. The next statement will be issued this afternoon by 11 AM EST.
